TopicTitle: Does anyone here try to voice-act for their Kerbals?

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone!

So recently, I made this video in which I did my best to act out what the four Kerbals sounded like. It was pretty fun to make, actually!

~~~

...but I'm sure my views on what they sound like are a little different from yours. This makes me curious!

Here's a thread about What You Think Your Kerbals Sound Like. Are they loud or quiet? Whiny, excited, constantly screaming, or worried? Are their voices high-pitched or just regular? You decide!

Oh, and if you have any examples of Kerbal voice-acting (in actual, recognizable English), please feel free to share 'em! If they're particularly good, they may well end up on this post (I'm almost intending this thread to be a sort of compilation of voice-acting for Kerbals). I know Roninpawn does a great job voice-acting, for example.

~~~

Anyway, thanks for stopping by! Have a nice day. 

-Upsilon

Edited January 26, 2016 by UpsilonAerospace

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGlLwYK_bx5w4ZDByE88Ecw

Bob Fitch (@Felbourn) has a pretty good natural voice to Kerbalize, and he's used it to great effect. He even voiced some of the fem kerbs I think before getting his wife and daughter in on the act.

Edited January 26, 2016 by Gaiiden

You know, it never crossed my mind to try this out.

Maybe I'll record my interpretation of (English) Kerbal speaking sometime...

I have a plan to for a video I'm trying to figure out. I'm wondering if I should go kerbish with subtitles or not.

I know it is reverse and speed up/pitched up Spanish. But, does anybody know if it is the whole sentence or just the words, and what the speed up rate was?

7 hours ago, steuben said:

But, does anybody know if it is the whole sentence or just the words, and what the speed up rate was?

Maybe you could get away with just plain gibberish, without the necessity of altering the voice clip(s).

e.g.: "Epsi Fou, Drackobey. Nam so fers beata."

 

Anyway, I took it upon myself to record a little skit where, after finally completing an orbit maneuver, Jeb, Bob and Bill take some time to both talk and accuse each other about past events;

http://www.filedropper.com/akerbalkonversation1

(Don't worry about the download page showing rude imagery ads, since I don't think I've come across it on this download site, but if I'm wrong and the link is taken down, I'll try and re-upload the track as a YouTube video)

Edited January 26, 2016 by Fred Cop

I just uploaded an episode where I was wanting to do voices, and puttering around with manipulating the pitch of my own voice.  I think I ended up with something similar to what Bob Fitch was doing before.

Anyway, you can check it out here.  This is my first "manned" mission to Minmus in Entering the Cosmos!, as told by Sean Kerman:
